name: The Crescendo Tool
tagline: Formal design and modelling using Co-Simulation
body:
### Welcome to The Crescendo Tool.

The Crescendo Tool is an open-source tool originally developed in the [EU DESTECS (Design Support and Tooling for Embedded Control Software)](http://www.destecs.org/) research project.  The focus is on using co-simulation to design and modelling cyber-physical systems.  The tool is based on the [Overture platform](http://www.overturetool.org/) and [Controllab's 20-sim](http://www.controllab.nl/en/products/20-sim.html).

### Getting the Crescendo tool.

Downloads of ready-to-run versions of the Crescendo Tool are presently hosted on the destecs.org website (and are branded as the DESTECS tool); the current version is [Release 1.3.8](http://www.destecs.org/downloads.html).  We expect a Crescendo-branded version to be available soon.

### Getting documentation.

Documentation may be found on [the download page](http://www.destecs.org/downloads.html) with the ready-to-run versions of the tool.

### Getting the code.

All of the Crescendo code will soon be hosted on GitHub, under the @crescendotool organisation account.  Everyone is welcome to grab it, fork it, and contribute.
